description.narrative: The GAVI Alliance is a public-private global health partnership committed to saving children's lives and protecting people's health by increasing access to immunisation in poor countries. It negotiates low-cost vaccines for eligible countries with a GNI per capita under US$1580. GAVI forecasts long term demand for vaccines, ensuring secure supply and price reductions for eligible countries and provides country grants to strengthen health systems, such as improving the supply, delivery and storage of vaccines. From 2000 to 2014, GAVI disbursed US$7.1 billion to 73 countries and 440 million children received one or more GAVI-supported vaccine. GAVI is on track to achieve its target of immunising a further 243 million children by the end of 2015. The total value of this investment is $200.0 million to be expensed during the 2015-16 financial year.
